32#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
33# include "config.h"
34#endif
35
36#include <sys/cdefs.h>
37__RCSID("$NetBSD: openpam_free_envlist.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:09 christos Exp $");
38
39#include <stdlib.h>
40
41#include <security/pam_appl.h>
42
43#include "openpam_impl.h"
44
45/*
46 * OpenPAM extension
47 *
48 * Free an environment list
49 */
50
51void
52openpam_free_envlist(char **envlist)
53{
54 char **env;
55
56 ENTER();
57 if (envlist == NULL)
58 RETURNV();
59 for (env = envlist; *env != NULL; ++env)
60 FREE(*env);
61 FREE(envlist);
62 RETURNV();
63}
64
65/*
66 * Error codes:
67 */
68
69/**
70 * The =openpam_free_envlist function is a convenience function which
71 * frees all the environment variables in an environment list, and the
72 * list itself.
73 * It is suitable for freeing the return value from =pam_getenvlist.
74 *
75 * AUTHOR DES
76 */
77
